intro: Coccoloba picardae, commonly known as the Caribbean beauty or Picard's coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean region, including parts of the Lesser Antilles and the Bahamas. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically bright green and have a smooth texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink, and it is often found in coastal areas or on rocky outcrops. Coccoloba picardae is an important component of the local flora and is adapted to thrive in saline and well-drained soils.
